greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = lcm{1,2,...,n} / binomial(n,floor(n/2)).
comment: If n = p^k where p is an odd prime and k >= 1, 2*n*a(n) = p*(n+1)*a(n-1).
If n is even and not a prime power, 2*a(n) = a(n-1).
If n is odd and not a prime power, 2*n*a(n) = (n+1)*a(n-1). (End)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = (e/2)^(n + o(1)). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 23 2015
mathematica: Join[{1}, Table[LCM @@ Range[n]/Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]], {n, 1, 50}]] (* or *) Table[Product[Cyclotomic[k, 1], {k, 2, n}]/Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 17 2017 *)
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Oct 23 2015
